p: 12. Fundamental ontology is the analysis of ex-sistence. In showing the ontic-ontological distinctiveness of ex-sistence we have also shown the ontic-ontological distinctiveness of the question about being. But § 2 showed that there is a unique relation between ex-sistence and the question of what accounts for being, and thereby intimated that in order to get clear on that question we first have to analyze ex-sistence in terms of its way of being. Such an analysis is what we call fundamental ontology.
